greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Denominator of Bigomega(n)/Omega(n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
formula: Let B = number of prime divisors of n with multiplicity, O = number of distinct prime divisors of n. Then a(n) = denominator of B/O.
program: def bigomega(n): return 0 if n==1 else bigomega(Integer(n)/primefactors(n)[0]) + 1
print([a(n) for n in range(2, 51)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jul 13 2017
xref: Cf. A070012, A070013, A070014, A088529 (gives the numerator).
results.author: _Cino Hilliard_, Nov 16 2003
